Depends on the accuracy you are aiming for. dissolved metals increase the entropy, so you would have to take that into consideration too. (https://chem.libretexts.org/Bookshelves/General_Chemistry/Book%3A_Chem1_(Lower)/08%3A_Solutions/8.02%3A_Thermodynamics_of_Solutions) The formula works on most liquids, within some degree of accuracy.

You can take moles if the heat capacity is molar. If specific heat capacity is given, you take mass.
Latent heat of fusion is the heat required for a substance to change from a solid to liquid (and vice versa). Enthalpy just means the content of heat and work a substance have.
